dc_description_s:
These data were collected as part of a study seeking to link initiation of calling and calling intensity of frogs in Eastern Ontario to local variation in microclimate and environment. Curtis Marsh (N 44.34.15.4 W 76.19.52.6) is one of a number
of sites at QUBS that was chosen for this, part of a survey that in 2012 encompassed over 25 sites from Bon Echo Provincial Park to St. Lawrence Islands National Park. Early data included only air temperature and humidity but this has expanded to include other variables including soil temperature and water temperature, as well as precipitation.
